To the right honorable, my very good Lorde,
e L Burghley, Lorde high Treasuro
r
of England.

30 Martij
1589
Mr Bodeley from
e Haghe.
Gertrudenbergh
./

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
L .uppon
e opportunitie
offered of this messenger, I thought to adde
this advertisment, to that whiche I signified
yesterday, That we are certified from sundrie
quarters, howe
e ennemie from
Malines
and
other places, marcheth towardes Gertrudenbergh:
because, as they give it out heere, there hath bin
secret intelligence between them and
e ennemie.
Howbeit for mine own e part, I hold it to be but
a brute devised by
e
states,
to give their pro-
ceeding a more plausible course. For otherwise
howe disorderly soever those of
e towne have ca-
ried themselves, I could never heare it suspected,
that they were come to
at degree of disloialtie.
It is rather thought,
at
e ennemie will make
his approche to
e towne, w
t
intent to take his ad-
vantage, as
e one side or other shall minister
occasion. As yet there is no speeche of any com-
position, betweene
e states and
e towne, nether
is there any likelyhood
at
e States will harcken
to any suche motion, from whomsoever it proceede,
unles happely in time they finde
at their enter-
prise will prove to be frustrat. Whiche will falle
out no better, as there are many heere
at thinke.
In
Brida
e gates have bin kept shutte these fouer
or five daies, whiche is construed as done uppon
an intention of some exploit towardes.
And so
ceasing to troble yo
r
L. further, I humbly take
my leave. From
e Hage. 30 Ma
r
88
Yo
r
L. most humble to c
o
maund Tho. Bodley.
